Comments
It's safe b/c there are security guards everywhere in the college, and theyr'e very helpful too if you're lost, and need help finding which building to go to class, pay bills, etc.
They have a few clubs and activities to do, but I don't care for them to be hones since I'm there to get a degree, nothing more than that.

The students in the school are pretty nice, and the teachers are good at what they do overall, so if you like that, you should try out this schoo. I also like how flexible the class schedules are, which makes things much easier for me in the long run (and for anybody who likes a flexible schudule too). Also, the buildings aren't that far away from each other, so I get to class on time everyday (good for students who never want to be late when going to class).

I do believe that the books are overpriced, including the used ones, but that's not a big deal. Also, they could make payment for classes cheaper b/c it's expensive. For example, I'm just doing one class in Winter Session now, but it costs over $500 just for that class (which to me is too much). Besides that though, I like the college so far.
You can join a few clubs if you like at the college, but the best thing to do is make friends, and hangout with them sometimes.
There are several different places you can go to eat.
There is no dorm at all.
It's good overall, but not the best.
I do believe that the books are overpriced, including the used ones, so make sure to check on other websites for better prices.

The students in the school are pretty nice, and the teachers are good at what they do overall. I like how flexible the class schedules are too, which makes things much easier for me in the long run. Also, the buildings aren't that far away from each other, so I get to class on time everyday.

textAfterTable: In three sentences the school is now expanding and trying to make commuting easier for students. the labs they offer and technology are always current with advancements. they offer joint programs with different colleges to further education from one aspect. Login to rate or flag the reviews Christian from Dover, NJ 12/06/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 2 out of 3 people found this review useful. 2 of 30 Categories Comments Bang for the buck Saved me alot!!!!!! Didnt go to CIA or J&W but learn just as much or probably even more for like 3/4 of the price Am learning a lot I am in the Culinary Program at Hudson. This was propably the best choice that i could have ever made. It is a small school with well trained chef that are still working in the buisness and teach.
